problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which state of matter has particles closely packed in a fixed, regular arrangement?
problems.hint: Particles vibrate in place without moving freely.
problems.detailed: Solids have particles closely packed in a fixed, regular arrangement, with strong intermolecular forces.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which state of matter has a fixed volume but no fixed shape, with particles that can slide past each other?
problems.hint: The shape adjusts to the container’s shape.
problems.detailed: Liquids have a fixed volume but no fixed shape because particles are close but not locked in place and can slide.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which state of matter has particles that are far apart, move freely, and fill the container they’re in?
problems.hint: Highly compressible and spreads out to fill the space.
problems.detailed: Gases have particles far apart and moving randomly, no fixed volume or shape, and fill any container.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which state of matter consists of ionized particles and conducts electricity, commonly found in stars and neon signs?
problems.hint: Contains positive ions and free electrons.
problems.detailed: Plasma consists of ionized particles (positive ions and free electrons), conducts electricity, and responds to magnetic fields.

problems.author: Thenura Wickramaratna
problems.question: Which of the following is true about compressibility of the states of matter?
problems.hint: Spaces between particles allow easy compression.
problems.detailed: Gases are highly compressible due to large spaces between particles; solids and liquids are much less so.
